availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Floyd County, Kentucky, grocer. Kentucky native. Married to Mariah Bingham. Father of James W. Bingham, Elijah Bingham, Susannah Bingham, Sarah Anne Bingham, Jefferson Bingham, William Bingham, Samuel Bingham, Soloman Bingham, Laura E. Bingham, and Deborah Bingham. Cooper in Clay County, Kentucky, in 1850. Grocer in Floyd County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Clay County, Kentucky District, p. 99B.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Floyd County, p. 6.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Floyd County, Precinct 8, p. 37.
